text:
I have a pass-thru rewrite rule that redirects URI to a JSP page:

RewriteRule /my/request/uri /my/target/jsp/script.jsp [PT,NC,L]

When access to this URI is blocked with error 406 (based on User-Agent, in this
case), the error message is:

"Not Acceptable

An appropriate representation of the requested resource
/my/target/jsp/script.jsp could not be found on this server."

I would think that mentioning a rewrite target discloses too much information.
Should not the error message mention the request URI (/my/request/uri) only?
After all the error messages are more of status messages for end-susers, not
debugging messages for webmasters.
When you use the PT flag, you're updating the URI.
